alert.note: Alert for Dundy (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 02 at 3:52AM CST until February 03 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM MST /MIDNIGHT CST/ THIS EVENING TO 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. * WHERE...In Kansas, Rawlins and Graham Counties. In Nebraska, Dundy County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Thursday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 11 PM MST /midnight CST/ this evening to 11 AM MST /noon CST/ Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions due to snowpacked roads. Snowfall rates today may produce visibilities as low as one-half mile. The hazardous conditions will impact travel across the area. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
